intro: Linophyllum humifusum, commonly known as the groundsel or common groundsel, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is a low-growing perennial that typically forms a dense mat of foliage near the ground. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. Linophyllum humifusum is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
